intro: Stengelia adoensis, commonly known as the Adoensis Stengelia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and linear, while its flowers are small and clustered in a composite head. Stengelia adoensis is noted for its ecological importance as a source of nectar for local pollinators.
